isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - Circuit Function And Diagnostics - Engine Data Line with Allison AT/MT Transmission (EDL)

svcproc.title: Engine Data Line with Allison AT/MT Transmission (EDL)

svcsubproc.title: Circuit Functions

figure.caption: Function Diagram for Engine Data Line

svcsubproc.para: The Electronic Control Module is programmed with two shift schedules: The Closed Throttle Mode and the Wide Open Throttle Mode.

step1.para: The Closed Throttle Mode is for situations with moderate engine load. ECM pin 56 will be Low (0V). This energizes the relay, turning off power to the transmission module shift solenoid, causing the transmission to shift at approximately 65% of engine load.

The Wide Open Throttle Mode is for heavy load situations. ECM pin 56 will be High (12V). This de-energizes the relay causing 12V to be applied to the solenoid. In this mode, the transmission shifts at approximately 80% of engine load.

svcsubproc.para: When the engine is operating at less than the load shift point, ignition voltage is not applied to the shift solenoid. When engine load is >80% the relay coil ground is opened by the ECM, which de-energizes the relay, supplying power to the shift solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection/management
svcsubproc.para: The EST is used to initiate the KOEO Output Circuit Tests. This will test the enabling circuit between the key switch, through the relay coil and circuit to ECM pin 56. If an open or short (high or low) is found in this circuit, Diagnostic Trouble Code 244 will be set.
Note that the test does not check relay function or the circuit to the shift solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: Engine Data Line (EDL) output from the ECM controls the Transmission Modulator Shift Solenoid Control Relay, which in turn controls the Transmission Modulator Shift Solenoid.
The ECM is programmed with two shift schedules: Closed Throttle Mode and Wide Open Throttle Mode.

item.para: The Closed Throttle Mode schedule pertains to applications when moderate engine load is encountered. The transmission will shift at approximately 65 percent of engine load.

The Wide Open Throttle Mode shift schedule has shift points that occur at 80 percent of engine load. This provides increased power output during heavy load situations where grades, passing, or lane acceleration are necessary.

svcsubproc.para:
See Allison Automatic Transmission System (N/Electronic XMSN) Circuit Diagram
for the following description.

The ECM analyzes engine operating data and determines which mode is correct for current operation. The Allison transmission uses Engine Data Line (EDL) output from ECM connector pin 56 to select the correct shift schedule depending upon engine loads.
When ECM pin 56 is LOW (0V), the transmission operates in the Closed Throttle Mode (normal shift schedule). When ECM pin 56 is HIGH (12V), the transmission operates in the Wide Open Throttle Mode.

svcsubproc.title: Wide Open Throttle Mode Operation
svcsubproc.para: In the Wide Open Throttle Mode, ECM pin 56 is HIGH (12V) and the XMSN Shift Modulator is energized. The Transmission Modulator Shift Solenoid Control Relay receives ignition power at common terminal 30 and control coil terminal 86. When ECM pin 56 is HIGH (12V), circuits 92F and 92E have 12V so the relay does not energize. The ignition power on circuit 92B goes through the normally closed (N.C.) contacts (30 to 87A) to the Transmission Modulator Shift Solenoid, causing the shift solenoid to energize.

svcsubproc.title: Closed Throttle Mode Operation
svcsubproc.para: In the Closed Throttle Mode, ECM pin 56 is LOW (0V) and Transmission Shift Modulator (404) is not energized. When ECM pin 56 is LOW (0V), circuit 92F grounds the Modulator Shift Control Relay control coil causing the relay to energize, opening the normally closed (N.C.) contacts (30 to 87A) in the relay, TURNING OFF the power to the Transmission Modulator Shift Solenoid, which is de-energized.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Diagnostics
svcsubproc.para: The ECM does not continuously monitor the EDL circuits. To check these circuits use the Electronic Service Tool (EST) to perform the KOEO - Output Circuit Checks (OCC).

The OCC Test checks Relay Control Coil circuits 92F, 92D, 92E and the relay control coil for opens or shorts (high or low). If a defect is noted, Diagnostic Trouble Code 244 will be set. The Engine Warning light does not turn ON.

Note that the ECM DIAGNOSTICS DO NOT check the actual operation of the Modulator Shift Solenoid Control relay or the Modulator Shift Solenoid. The ECM DIAGNOSTICS also do not check circuits 92B, 92C or 92-G. For these reasons, it is possible for the Allison AT/MT transmission Modulator Shift Solenoid not to function, without a Diagnostic Trouble Code.
